p: Although the C. gileadensis essential oils were dominated by monoterpenoids, several of these have demonstrated antimicrobial activity, validating the use of exudates from this plant to treat burns, wounds, and infections. Thus, for example, α-pinene [ 26, 27], sabinene [ 28], β-pinene [ 29], p-cymene [ 30, 31], limonene [ 29], γ-terpinene [ 32], and terpinen-4-ol [ 32, 33] have shown antimicrobial activities.
